snippet: The federal coal leasing program run by the Bureau of Land Management does not have a consistent means of ensuring that fair prices are paid for the leases, a new report says.
abstract: Government Accountability Office report says federal coal leasing program run by Bureau of Land Management operates without sufficient oversight or consistent means of ensuring that fair prices are paid for leases.
lead_paragraph: The federal coal leasing program run by the Bureau of Land Management does not have a consistent means of ensuring that fair prices are paid for the leases, a new report says.

headline.main: Government Said to Undervalue Coal Leases
headline.print_headline: Government Said to Undervalue Coal Leases
